str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
This; he, she, it.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Present participle of archo; a first.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Air, the lower air we breathe. From aemi; 'air'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Willful unbelief, obstinacy, disobedience. From apeithes; disbelief.
